narrative=Fiona Houghton, known as MP, was reported missing after she failed to return home from her usual afternoon walk. Concerned, her friend, Bethany Moran, contacted authorities when MP did not answer her phone. MP was last thought to have been seen near a tunnel along Fulton Road, a route she frequently took for walks. With sparse details to go on, authorities intensified their search efforts, combing through nearby areas, eventually focusing on the vast desert-like terrain surrounding the path. Six days later, MP was traced unharmed at 224-226 Archerhill Road, Glasgow. Despite initial concerns due to her disability and advanced age, MP was found in good health, having reportedly wandered off and lost her way.

narrative=Fiona Houghton, a 93-year-old with a history of cognitive challenges, was reported missing from her home on Castlecary Road. Normally active in her senior housing community, Fiona was last known to be attending a physical therapy session, but she never returned. Her brother, increasingly worried after she missed their weekly call, checked the nearby urban areas where Fiona enjoyed wandering. Reports came from witnesses who had seen her boarding a bus towards Cardross Road, G82 5DH, a route she took when attending her grandchild's school events. After a multi-day search, the police traced her to Fulton Road, G62 8PG. Fiona was found safe, albeit confused, in an area she frequently described as reminiscent of her childhood in Wrexham, bringing the incident to a relieved closure.
